title: Nintendo just teased a mysterious new device for the Nintendo Switch that will be revealed next week
text:
Nintendo has a big reveal coming up next week, and it definitely involves the wildly popular Nintendo Switch.

The company says it's a "First look at a new experience for Nintendo Switch."

That's unfortunately where the solid facts more or less end.

A short teaser video released Thursday night depicts various people all over the world using a wheellike peripheral and a leg-strap peripheral to play some type of physical-activity-based game.

Nintendo

Both the wheellike device and the strap are able to accommodate at least one Joy-Con gamepad, which allows the peripherals to speak to the Nintendo Switch console.

In the case of the leg strap, the Joy-Con can even be seen throughout use:

Nintendo

People using the peripherals in the teaser are seen doing a variety of different activities, from squats to leg presses to straight-up running in place.

In so many words, this peripheral — and whatever software corresponds to it — looks to be a kind of spiritual successor to stuff like "Wii Fit" and "Wii Sports."

One thing's for sure: We'll assuredly find out more on September 12 when Nintendo reveals whatever this is teasing.

Check out the teaser trailer right here:
description: It looks like Nintendo is about to announce a spiritual successor to its hit exercise software, "Wii Fit."
